file_content.text: You may speak to the baron, if you so desire.
This is Captain Perovius. A pleasure to hear from you, your highness--I'm impressed that you conducted the search personally.
This is Captain Perovius. It's good to see you again--I'm impressed that you conducted the search personally.
We're receiving the droids' logs now. You have my thanks.
No thanks are necessary. It was my privilege.
Don't worry about it.
I would've lost men conducting the search. You saved lives today.
I'd appreciate it if you let the baron know about my help.
Tell that to your masters.
He'll hear. Don't you worry.
I don't send others to do my dirty work, and I get the job done.
I know how to handle things.
A rare thing for a noble of your position.
Maybe I underestimated you. I apologize.
At any rate, these logs are... discouraging. The droids skirmished with the Killiks--blasted bugs are on Cortess lands again.
Don't you get along with the Killiks?
Bugs?
I hope you're joking. Those creatures... I hear they take captives, transform them into slaves. I can't imagine a worse fate.
I ran into a few more on my way here.
I've seen them.
Figures as much.
I wouldn't know anything about that.
If you say so.
It's alright. I'm not expecting any answers.
Rumor has it that the Killik nest is growing. Probably scouting for a new home.
I'll make sure the baron knows. Those things won't build a new hive in Cortess territory, I'll tell you that!
I'm sure the Killiks will get your message.
Undoubtedly.
Indeed. In the meantime, I have a message for you.
Now that I've done my part, may I see the baron?
Can I visit your house?
Not my concern.
Of course. You've done more than your part.
The baroness is offering you an invitation to the estate. You may return at your leisure.
Hold your guard!
In the name of Baron Peyar Cortess and the Cortess barony, I demand you state your business--or face expulsion.
How dare you speak this way to me? I am a count of House Thul!
I'm nobility, of course.
How dare you speak this way to me? I am a countess of House Thul!
I'm nobility, of course.
House Thul? Forgive me, your highness. It's sometimes difficult to recognize an adopted heir.
Indeed? Forgive me, your highness--if I'd known you were coming...
I knew nothing of Thul emissaries either, Captain.
I am Baroness Chay Cortess, your highness. Forgive our inhospitality, but my husband has no time for visitors.
Watch your tone. House Cortess is merely a vassal, and would be nothing without House Thul.
Obey your betters!
I am one of the free soldiers of the Perlemian Trade Route, come to offer my company's services.
I'm a mercenary captain.
Another mercenary thug, then, come to Alderaan for a few credits.
Best mercenary thug this side of the Rim.
Captain Perovius--there's no need to react this way.
Forgive me, my lady.
I am Baroness Chay Cortess. Forgive our lack of hospitality, but these are inhospitable times.
And quite frankly, Cortess has no need of mercenaries. Friends, yes--but not armies for hire.
Allow me to prove that I can be a friend.
So let's get acquainted.
Perhaps.
Of course.
Hired or not, Cortess needs all the help it can get.
Cortess is weak.
If you wish a relationship with my house, mercenary, listen closely.
My business is my own. Get these thugs out of my way.
I don't answer to you.
Huh. Imperial arrogance. I thought your people stayed in House Thul.
Do you doubt a servant of the Empire might visit us, Captain? We're supposed to be allies, after all.
I'm sorry, my lady. I'm merely surprised.
As for you... I am Baroness Chay Cortess. Please forgive our lack of hospitality, but my husband has no time for visitors.
Have we offended you in some way, my lady?
What've I done wrong?
I believe he'll want to speak to me. It's a matter of life and death.
This is urgent.
Aren't they all, though?
Watch your tone. Your house would be nothing without the Empire!
Obey your betters!
My house has a proud and noble position. Don't say such things.
Some days ago, we lost a squad of battle droids patrolling the borders of Cortess lands. That squad was our first line of defense.
We believe the squad's disappearance may presage an attack. Yet not one of our allies has come to our aid.
That explains a great deal. You have my sympathies, Baroness.
I'm sorry.
I'm not looking for sympathy.
What happened to the squad, exactly?
Disappearance?
What makes you think I was involved with your lost squad?
You think I'm responsible?
Nothing. But you've done naught to make my house safer.
We don't know what destroyed our droids--they went silent. Until we find out, we must prepare for the worst.
If you want our favor, send your troops to determine the fate of our patrol. Perhaps then my baron may host guests.
If you wish to make amends, send your troops to determine the fate of our patrol. Perhaps that will make my baron smile again.
We'll do everything possible to make this right.
As you wish.
Of course. I'll send a legion of my best men.
My troops, huh?
This is absurd.
Whatever destroyed our patrol is a threat to my house. Until we know what we're dealing with, we admit no one.
I'll leave you to Captain Perovius. I hope to see you under better circumstances.
Your highness--if your men find the droids, tell them to activate the squad's homing beacon. Perhaps the data logs will help us.
Huh. If your troops find the droids, tell them to activate the squad's homing beacon. Perhaps the data logs will help us.
You're an intruder in our house. Begone.
I don't like so many strangers around the estate.
